channel.title: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence
channel.description: Posts from Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: #DYK : the state of jails and prisons in colorado and across our...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#DYK : the state of jails and prisons in colorado and across our country are an atrocity. "incarcerated people" are not worth less than "free people." see #CAAPV's response to governor polis's comments below, as well as a letter by our friends at Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition below.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-sheriff-department-cre…/
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

https://www.denverpost.com/…/denver-sheriff-department-cre…/

Dozens of Denver sheriff’s deputies have histories of lying or criminal activity that may impact their credibility in court — including the sheriff himself.

denverpost.com

57 Denver sheriff’s deputies — and the sheriff — have potential credibility issues, review finds

Dozens of Denver sheriff’s deputies have histories of lying or criminal activity that may impact their credibility in court — including the sheriff himself.Dozens of Denver sheriff’s deputies have histories of lying or criminal activity that may impact their credibility in court — including the sheriff himself.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: “T he Denver Post requested Brady lists from each of the 22...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

“T he Denver Post requested Brady lists from each of the 22 district attorneys’ offices in Colorado. From the nine offices that provided a list, The Post compiled a list of 466 current and former law enforcement officers with criminal convictions, histories of lying, excessive force incidents or other backgrounds that could impact their credibility in court. The records offer insight into the often-opaque realm of police discipline in Colorado, but because some offices withhe...ld their lists it’s impossible to know how many other officers have a Brady designation, whether they’re still working in law enforcement or whether an officer on a list in one jurisdiction has moved to another.

That means it can be difficult for people to know whether an officer testifying against them in court or issuing a ticket has lied before, or whether the officers entrusted with arresting powers to keep communities safe are trustworthy themselves.”

https://www.denverpost.com/…/colorado-police-credibility-b…/

See MoreEvery district attorney in Colorado tracks officers whose pasts may need to be disclosed in court. But it’s difficult to know which officers are included on prosecutors’ lists because there is no s…

denverpost.com

Uneven approach to Colorado police officers with questionable credibility leaves public in the dark

Every district attorney in Colorado tracks officers whose pasts may need to be disclosed in court. But it’s difficult to know which officers are included on prosecutors’ lists because there is no s…Every district attorney in Colorado tracks officers whose pasts may need to be disclosed in court. But it’s difficult to know which officers are included on prosecutors’ lists because there is no s…

item.title: we’ll say it again: jail and prison should not be a death...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

we’ll say it again: jail and prison should not be a death sentence.

https://www.cpr.org/…/aclu-trying-to-force-polis-hand-on-…/…

The organization wants a judge to order Polis to reduce prison populations, possibly by letting some non-violent offenders out early.

cpr.org

ACLU Trying To Force Polis’ Hand On Dealing With COVID-19 In Prisons

The organization wants a judge to order Polis to reduce prison populations, possibly by letting some non-violent offenders out early.The organization wants a judge to order Polis to reduce prison populations, possibly by letting some non-violent offenders out early.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: Great commentary from Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Great commentary from Colorado Criminal Justice Reform Coalition on Polis's comments attempting to limit prisoners's access to a COVID-19 vaccine:

"The issue on the table isn’t who is more “deserving” to receive the vaccine but, rather, how to deploy the vaccine as strategically as possible to ensure the health of essential workers, to reduce infection in high transmission environments, and to prioritize those individuals most vulnerable due to age or underlying medical cond...ition.

Over 4,300 incarcerated people have tested positive for COVID, which is 30% of the entire adult prison population, and that figure is surging. To put this in context, if the overall state population had an infection rate of 30%, rather than having 236,000 people who have been infected, it would be over 1.3 million."

https://www.denverpost.com/…/covid-vaccine-colorado-jails-…/

See MoreAt his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…

denverpost.com

Guest Commentary: Jails and prisons direly need vaccines to protect everyone else in Colorado

At his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…At his press conference Tuesday, the governor cavalierly announced that he was amending the vaccine distribution plan to no longer consider prison facilities a priority for receiving the COVID vacc…

item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

despicable.

https://www.denverpost.com/…/polis-covid-vaccine-prison-ja…/

In a position he’s stated twice in the last week, Gov. Jared Polis said he believes incarcerated people should not receive access to upcoming vaccines ahead of free people.

denverpost.com

Gov. Polis says Colorado prisoners shouldn’t get COVID-19 vaccine before free people

In a position he’s stated twice in the last week, Gov. Jared Polis said he believes incarcerated people should not receive access to upcoming vaccines ahead of free people.In a position he’s stated twice in the last week, Gov. Jared Polis said he believes incarcerated people should not receive access to upcoming vaccines ahead of free people.

item.title: the government should not and cannot kill our own. ...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

the government should not and cannot kill our own.

https://www.elle.com/…/lisa-montgomery-death-row-execution…/

Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.

elle.com

My Baby Sister Lisa Did a Terrible Thing. We Shouldn't Kill Her For It.

Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.Lisa Montgomery strangled a pregnant woman to death. Her sister, Diane, wants her off death row.

item.title: pretrial detention or a jail sentence should not be a death...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

pretrial detention or a jail sentence should not be a death sentence. ￼

https://www.cpr.org/…/as-pandemic-worsens-mask-rules-in-ja…/

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.

cpr.org

As Pandemic Worsens, Mask Rules In Jails Vary From County To County

CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.CPR News has found that jails across Colorado have varying policies on both supplying masks and requiring inmates to wear them throughout their jail stays.
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: #DYK: felony disenfranchisement is a subversive way to silence...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#DYK: felony disenfranchisement is a subversive way to silence the voices of our most vulnerable.

those caged in prisons across our state are banned from voting, but are still counted for census benefits. this is a way the state uses their bodies to support the systems that oppress them while continuing to keep them hidden from view, in horrifying conditions, and away from their loved ones. it must stop.

#CAAPV
item.author: Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

item.title: CPAT is a tool to allow our carceral state to act as it is...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

CPAT is a tool to allow our carceral state to act as it is intended - by disproportionately caging people of color.

https://www.boulderweekly.com/news/analyzing-the-risk/

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

boulderweekly.com

Let’s start with a theoretical scenario: Al Capone and Mother Theresa are both arrested and charged with committing murder. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Based on that charge, bond is set at $5 million for each of them. Given what we know about them, who do you think would be seen as a lower risk to the community if released? ...

A Denver sheriff deputy used excessive force when he struck a jail inmate in the back of the head with nunchucks and caused the inmate to be hospitalized, Denver public safety officials found.

item.title: Denver sheriff’s deputy suspended 10 days for crashing car...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

Denver sheriff’s deputy suspended 10 days for crashing car while driving at nearly 4 times legal DUI limit https://www.denverpost.com/…/…/05/denver-sheriff-deputy-dui/

A Denver sheriff’s deputy narrowly avoided being fired for crashing a car into a highway barrier while his blood alcohol content was nearly four times the legal limit.

denverpost.com

Denver sheriff’s deputy suspended 10 days for crashing car while driving at nearly 4 times legal DUI limit

A Denver sheriff’s deputy narrowly avoided being fired for crashing a car into a highway barrier while his blood alcohol content was nearly four times the legal limit.A Denver sheriff’s deputy narrowly avoided being fired for crashing a car into a highway barrier while his blood alcohol content was nearly four times the legal limit.

item.title: #DAsAreCopsToo #CAAPV...
item.content:encoded:
Colorado Attorneys Against Police Violence

#DAsAreCopsToo #CAAPV

https://www.denverpost.com/…/plea-deals-racial-bias-colora…/

While nearly all justice is doled out through plea bargaining, none of the district attorney’s offices in the Denver area track the data necessary to know if there are racial disparities in the way…

denverpost.com

Most criminal justice in Colorado comes through plea deals, but DAs don’t track whether the process is racially biased

While nearly all justice is doled out through plea bargaining, none of the district attorney’s offices in the Denver area track the data necessary to know if there are racial disparities in the way…While nearly all justice is doled out through plea bargaining, none of the district attorney’s offices in the Denver area track the data necessary to know if there are racial disparities in the way…
